labels.analysis: The MCP Server "JigsawStack Image Generation" provides functionality to generate images from textual prompts using advanced AI models. Its primary purpose is to facilitate the creation of visual content based on user-specified descriptions. The available tool, "image_generation," indicates that the server interacts with JigsawStack's AI image generation API, which suggests a focus on AI-powered creative and visualization tasks.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of generating images from text clearly aligns with "AI/ML Tools," as it leverages machine learning models for content creation. While image generation could also relate to "Content Creation," the technical nature of the underlying AI models places it more prominently in the AI/ML category.

Generate images from text using advanced AI models. Learn more about jigsawstack's image generation API here: https://jigsawstack.com/docs/api-reference/ai/image-generation

You can get your jigsawstack API key here: https://jigsawstack.com/dashboard/

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@JigsawStack/image-generation/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
